summary.span: 表示任意大的带符号整数。

span.span: Represents an arbitrarily large signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类型是不可变类型，表示其值在理论上有没有上限或下限的边界的任意大整数。The type is an immutable type that represents an arbitrarily large integer whose value in theory has no upper or lower bounds. 成员类型紧密几乎与其他整数类型 ( ， ， ， ， ， ， ，和类型)。The members of the type closely parallel those of other integral types (the , , , , , , , and types). 此类型与其他整数类型中不同[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]，其中包含所指示的范围及其`MinValue`和`MaxValue`属性。This type differs from the other integral types in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], which have a range indicated by their `MinValue` and `MaxValue` properties. > [!NOTE] > 因为类型是固定不变 (请参阅[可变性和 BigInteger 结构](#mutability))，因为它具有无上限或下限指定边界内可以为任何操作都将导致引发值太增长大型。Because the type is immutable (see [Mutability and the BigInteger Structure](#mutability)) and because it has no upper or lower bounds, an can be thrown for any operation that causes a value to grow too large. ## 实例化 BigInteger 对象Instantiating a BigInteger Object 可以实例化几种方式的对象：You can instantiate a object in several ways: - 可以使用`new`关键字，并作为参数提供的任何整型或浮点值构造函数。You can use the `new` keyword and provide any integral or floating-point value as a parameter to the constructor. (浮点值将被截断之前分配给。)下面的示例演示如何使用`new`关键字来实例化值。(Floating-point values are truncated before they are assigned to the .) The following example illustrates how to use the `new` keyword to instantiate values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#1)] - 您可以声明变量并将分配一个值，就像您一样任何数值类型，前提是该值是一种整型类型。You can declare a variable and assign it a value just as you would any numeric type, as long as that value is an integral type. 下面的示例使用分配来创建值从。The following example uses assignment to create a value from an . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#2)] - 可以将分配到的十进制或浮点值对象，如果将值强制转换或首先将其转换。You can assign a decimal or floating-point value to a object if you cast the value or convert it first. 下面的示例显式强制转换 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic) 将转换和一个值设为。The following example explicitly casts (in C#) or converts (in Visual Basic) a and a value to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#3)] 这些方法使你能够实例化对象，其值是一个现有的数值的范围中的类型。These methods enable you to instantiate a object whose value is in the range of one of the existing numeric types only. 可以实例化其值可以超过三种方式之一中的现有数值类型的范围的对象：You can instantiate a object whose value can exceed the range of the existing numeric types in one of three ways: - 可以使用`new`关键字，并提供到任意大小的字节数组构造函数。You can use the `new` keyword and provide a byte array of any size to the constructor. 例如:For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#4)] - 您可以调用或方法将转换到的数字的字符串表示形式。You can call the or methods to convert the string representation of a number to a . 例如:For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#5)] - 您可以调用`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)方法，用于对数值表达式执行某种操作并返回计算结果。You can call a `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) method that performs some operation on a numeric expression and returns a calculated result. 下面的示例执行此通过多维并将分配到结果。The following example does this by cubing and assigning the result to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#6)] 未初始化的值是。The uninitialized value of a is . ## 对 BigInteger 值执行操作Performing Operations on BigInteger Values 可以使用实例像使用任何其他整数类型。You can use a instance as you would use any other integral type. 重载标准数值运算符，以使您能够执行基本的数学运算，例如加法、 减法、 除法、 乘法、 减法、 求反和一元求反。 overloads the standard numeric operators to enable you to perform basic mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, subtraction, negation, and unary negation. 此外可以使用标准数字运算符比较两个与每个其他的值。You can also use the standard numeric operators to compare two values with each other. 与其他整数类型，类似还支持按位`And`， `Or`， `XOr`，左移位和右移位运算符。Like the other integral types, also supports the bitwise `And`, `Or`, `XOr`, left shift, and right shift operators. 不支持自定义运算符的语言结构还提供了用于执行数学运算的等效方法。For languages that do not support custom operators, the structure also provides equivalent methods for performing mathematical operations. 其中包括， ， ， ， ，以及其他几个人。These include , , , , , and several others. 很多成员的结构直接对应于其他整数类型的成员。Many members of the structure correspond directly to members of the other integral types. 此外，添加成员，如下所示：In addition, adds members such as the following: - 它返回一个值，指示的符号值。, which returns a value that indicates the sign of a value. - 它返回的绝对值值。, which returns the absolute value of a value. - 它返回商和余数的除法运算。, which returns both the quotient and remainder of a division operation. - 它将返回两个最大公约值。, which returns the greatest common divisor of two values. 许多这些其他成员对应于的成员类，该类提供的功能，以使用基元数值类型。Many of these additional members correspond to the members of the class, which provides the functionality to work with the primitive numeric types. ## 可变性和 BigInteger 结构Mutability and the BigInteger Structure 下面的示例实例化对象，然后按 1 递增其值。The following example instantiates a object and then increments its value by one. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#1)] 虽然此示例中修改现有对象的值，这不是这种情况。Although this example appears to modify the value of the existing object, this is not the case. 对象是不可变的这意味着在内部，公共语言运行时实际创建一个新对象，并将其分配值的值大于其以前的值。 objects are immutable, which means that internally, the common language runtime actually creates a new object and assigns it a value one greater than its previous value. 此新对象然后返回到调用方。This new object is then returned to the caller. > [!NOTE] > .NET Framework 中的其他数字类型也是不可变的。The other numeric types in the .NET Framework are also immutable. 但是，因为类型具有无上限或下限的边界，其值可以变得非常大并对性能产生明显的影响。However, because the type has no upper or lower bounds, its values can grow extremely large and have a measurable impact on performance. 尽管此过程是透明的调用方，但它确实会招致对性能产生负面影响。Although this process is transparent to the caller, it does incur a performance penalty. 在某些情况下，尤其是当重复的操作都会在循环中对执行非常大值，可显著的性能损失。In some cases, especially when repeated operations are performed in a loop on very large values, that performance penalty can be significant. 例如，在以下示例中，执行操作重复最多万次，和一个每次该操作成功，值都会递增 1。For example, in the following example, an operation is performed repetitively up to a million times, and a value is incremented by one every time the operation succeeds. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#12)] 在这种情况下，可以提高性能，通过执行所有中间分配到变量。In such a case, you can improve performance by performing all intermediate assignments to an variable. 然后，该变量的最终值可以分配给对象循环退出后。The final value of the variable can then be assigned to the object when the loop exits. 下面的示例进行了这方面的演示。The following example provides an illustration. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#3)] ## 使用字节数组和十六进制字符串Working with Byte Arrays and Hexadecimal Strings 如果您在转换值到字节数组，或如果您在转换到的字节数组值，必须考虑的字节顺序。If you convert values to byte arrays, or if you convert byte arrays to values, you must consider the order of bytes. 结构需要在要显示在 little-endian 顺序中的字节数组中的各个字节 （即，值的较低序位字节前加上更高序位字节）。The structure expects the individual bytes in a byte array to appear in little-endian order (that is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes). 你可以往返值通过调用方法，然后将传递生成的字节数组到构造函数，如以下示例所示。You can round-trip a value by calling the method and then passing the resulting byte array to the constructor, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#1)] 若要实例化值从字节数组，表示值的一些其他整数类型，可以传递到整数的值方法，并生成的字节数组到然后传递构造函数。To instantiate a value from a byte array that represents a value of some other integral type, you can pass the integral value to the method, and then pass the resulting byte array to the constructor. 下面的示例实例化值从字节数组，表示值。The following example instantiates a value from a byte array that represents an value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#2)] 结构假定负值会存储通过使用 2 的补数表示。The structure assumes that negative values are stored by using two's complement representation. 因为结构表示没有固定的长度，值的数值构造函数始终解释为符号位数组中的最后一个字节的最高有效位。Because the structure represents a numeric value with no fixed length, the constructor always interprets the most significant bit of the last byte in the array as a sign bit. 若要防止让人迷惑不解的 2 的补数表示的值为负正是正数值的符号和量值表示形式的构造函数中的值的最高有效位的字节数组中的最后一个字节通常为集应包含额外的字节，其值为 0。To prevent the constructor from confusing the two's complement representation of a negative value with the sign and magnitude representation of a positive value, positive values in which the most significant bit of the last byte in the byte array would ordinarily be set should include an additional byte whose value is 0. 例如，0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 是 1000000 或 4293967296 的小字节序十六进制表示形式。For example, 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF is the little-endian hexadecimal representation of either -1,000,000 or 4,293,967,296. 此数组中的最后一个字节的最高有效位是打开的因为将通过解释的字节数组值为-1000000 的构造函数。Because the most significant bit of the last byte in this array is on, the value of the byte array would be interpreted by the constructor as -1,000,000. 若要实例化其值为正，字节数组，其元素是 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 必须传递给构造函数。To instantiate a whose value is positive, a byte array whose elements are 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 must be passed to the constructor. 下面的示例阐释了这一点。The following example illustrates this. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#3)] 创建的字节数组从正值的方法包括此额外的零值字节。Byte arrays created by the method from positive values include this extra zero-value byte. 因此，结构成功往返值可以通过分配它们，然后将它们还原从字节数组，如以下示例所示。Therefore, the structure can successfully round-trip values by assigning them to, and then restoring them from, byte arrays, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#4)] 但是，您可能需要将此额外的零值字节添加到开发人员通过动态创建的或通过将无符号的整数转换为字节数组的方法返回的字节数组 (如， ，和)。However, you may need to add this additional zero-value byte to byte arrays that are created dynamically by the developer or that are returned by methods that convert unsigned integers to byte arrays (such as , , and ). 分析十六进制字符串时和方法假定，如果在字符串中的第一个字节的最高有效位设置，或如果字符串的第一个十六进制数字表示较低的四位的字节值，该值为使用 2 的补数表示形式来表示。When parsing a hexadecimal string, the and methods assume that if the most significant bit of the first byte in the string is set, or if the first hexadecimal digit of the string represents the lower four bits of a byte value, the value is represented by using two's complement representation. 例如，"FF01"和"F01"表示的十进制值-255。For example, both "FF01" and "F01" represent the decimal value -255. 若要区分正负值，正值应包含前导零。To differentiate positive from negative values, positive values should include a leading zero. 相关的重载方法，传递"X"格式字符串时, 添加到正值返回的十六进制字符串前导零。The relevant overloads of the method, when they are passed the "X" format string, add a leading zero to the returned hexadecimal string for positive values. 这样就可以往返使用值和方法，如以下示例所示。This makes it possible to round-trip values by using the and methods, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#5)] 但是，通过调用创建的十六进制字符串`ToString`其他整数类型或重载的方法方法，包括`toBase`参数未指示的值或从其源数据类型的符号十六进制字符串被派生。However, the hexadecimal strings created by calling the `ToString` methods of the other integral types or the overloads of the method that include a `toBase` parameter do not indicate the sign of the value or the source data type from which the hexadecimal string was derived. 已成功实例化从这样的字符串值需要一些额外的逻辑。Successfully instantiating a value from such a string requires some additional logic. 下面的示例提供了一种可能实现。The following example provides one possible implementation. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples2.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples2.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的单个字节`value`数组应在 little-endian 顺序，从最低序位字节设置为最高序位字节。The individual bytes in the `value` array should be in little-endian order, from lowest-order byte to highest-order byte. 例如，数值 1000000000000 表示下表中所示：For example, the numeric value 1,000,000,000,000 is represented as shown in the following table: ||| |-|-| |十六进制字符串Hexadecimal string|E8D4A51000E8D4A51000| |字节数组 （首先最低索引）Byte array (lowest index first)|00 10 A5 D4 E8 0000 10 A5 D4 E8 00| 如将数字值转换为字节数组的大多数方法和，在 little-endian 顺序中返回字节数组。Most methods that convert numeric values to byte arrays, such as and , return byte arrays in little-endian order. 构造函数中要使用符号数值表示法，并且负值使用 2 的补数表示的字节数组需要正的值。The constructor expects positive values in the byte array to use sign-and-magnitude representation, and negative values to use two's complement representation. 换而言之，如果最高顺序位中的最高序位字节`value`设置，则结果值为负。In other words, if the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in `value` is set, the resulting value is negative. 根据字节数组的源，这可能会导致正值将被错误解释为负值。Depending on the source of the byte array, this may cause a positive value to be misinterpreted as a negative value. 字节数组通常按以下方式生成：Byte arrays are typically generated in the following ways: - 通过调用方法。By calling the method. 此方法返回到正值零数组集中具有最高序位字节的最高顺序位的字节数组，因为没有可能将解释为负正数值。Because this method returns a byte array with the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in the array set to zero for positive values, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. 以未修改形式创建的字节数组方法时传递给总是能成功往返构造函数。Unmodified byte arrays created by the method always successfully round-trip when they are passed to the constructor. - 通过调用方法，并将其作为参数传递的有符号的整数。By calling the method and passing it a signed integer as a parameter. 由于处理有符号的整数的符号数值表示法和 2 的补数表示，没有可能将解释为负正数值。Because signed integers handle both sign-and-magnitude representation and two's complement representation, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. - 通过调用方法，并将其作为参数传递的无符号的整数。By calling the method and passing it an unsigned integer as a parameter. 因为由其量值仅表示无符号的整数，正值被误解为负值。Because unsigned integers are represented by their magnitude only, positive values can be misinterpreted as negative values. 若要防止这种误解，可以将零字节值添加到数组末尾。To prevent this misinterpretation, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 下一节中的示例提供了说明。The example in the next section provides an illustration. - 通过创建一个字节数组，或者动态或静态而不一定调用任何以前的方法，或通过修改现有的字节数组。By creating a byte array either dynamically or statically without necessarily calling any of the previous methods, or by modifying an existing byte array. 若要防止正值错误地解释为负值，可以将零字节值添加到数组末尾。To prevent positive values from being misinterpreted as negative values, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 如果`value`是一个空数组，则新对象将初始化为值为。If `value` is an empty array, the new object is initialized to a value of . 如果`value`是`null`，构造函数引发。If `value` is `null`, the constructor throws an . ## Examples 下面的示例实例化5 元素字节数组，其值是 {5，4，3，2，1} 中的对象。The following example instantiates a object from a 5-element byte array whose value is {5, 4, 3, 2, 1}. 然后，它显示值，表示为十进制和十六进制数字，到控制台。It then displays the value, represented as both decimal and hexadecimal numbers, to the console. 文本输出与输入数组的比较可以清楚为什么的此重载类构造函数创建对象，其值为 4328719365 （或 0x102030405）。A comparison of the input array with the text output makes it clear why this overload of the class constructor creates a object whose value is 4328719365 (or 0x102030405). 字节数组，其值为 5，第一个元素定义的值的最低序位字节对象，它是 0x05:sp。The first element of the byte array, whose value is 5, defines the value of the lowest-order byte of the object, which is 0x05. 字节数组，其值为 4，第二个元素定义的第二个字节的值对象，它是 0x04，依次类推。The second element of the byte array, whose value is 4, defines the value of the second byte of the object, which is 0x04, and so on. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#1)] 下面的示例实例化正和负值时，请将它们传递到方法，然后还原原始中生成的字节数组的值。The following example instantiates a positive and a negative value, passes them to the method, and then restores the original values from the resulting byte array. 请注意两个值由相同的字节数组。Note that the two values are represented by identical byte arrays. 唯一区别是中字节数组中的最后一个元素的最高有效位。The only difference between them is in the most significant bit of the last element in the byte array. 此位是设置 （的字节的值为 0xFF），如果该数组创建从负值。This bit is set (the value of the byte is 0xFF) if the array is created from a negative value. 位未设置 （的字节的值为零），如果该数组创建一个正从值。The bit is not set (the value of the byte is zero), if the array is created from a positive value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#2)] 下面的示例演示如何确保，正值不错误地实例化作为负值通过添加其值为 0 到数组末尾的字节。The following example illustrates how to make sure that a positive value is not incorrectly instantiated as a negative value by adding a byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 最大公约数是在其中的最大数字这两个值可以划分而不返回余数。The greatest common divisor is the largest number into which the two values can be divided without returning a remainder. 如果`left`和`right`参数为非零的数字，该方法始终返回最小值为 1，因为所有数字可都除以 1。If the `left` and `right` parameters are non-zero numbers, the method always returns at least a value of 1 because all numbers can be divided by 1. 如果任一参数为零，该方法将返回非零参数的绝对值。If either parameter is zero, the method returns the absolute value of the non-zero parameter. 如果这两个值均为零，该方法将返回零。If both values are zero, the method returns zero. > [!NOTE] > 计算的非常大的值的最大公约`left`和`right`可以是一个非常耗时的操作。Computing the greatest common divisor of very large values of `left` and `right` can be a very time-consuming operation. 返回的值方法始终是正而不考虑的符号`left`和`right`参数。The value returned by the method is always positive regardless of the sign of the `left` and `right` parameters. ## Examples 下面的示例阐释如何调用方法和异常处理提供了一些有用的信息所需。The following example illustrates a call to the method and the exception handling necessary to provide useful information about an . 结果表示这两个数字的最大公约为 1。The result indicates that the greatest common divisor of these two numbers is 1. remarks.format: ## Remarks 语言不支持运算符重载的实现方法。The method is implemented for languages that do not support operator overloading. 其行为与使用乘法运算符的乘法完全相同。Its behavior is identical to multiplication using the multiplication operator. 此外，方法实例化时是乘法运算符的有用替代变量通过将其分配乘法，而得出的产品，如下面的示例中所示。In addition, the method is a useful substitute for the multiplication operator when instantiating a variable by assigning it a product that results from multiplication, as shown in the following example. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/cs/Multiply1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/vb/Multiply1.vb#1)] 如果有必要，此方法会自动执行隐式转换为其他整数类型对象。If necessary, this method automatically performs implicit conversion of other integral types to objects. 在下一节中的示例阐释了这其中方法传递两个值。This is illustrated in the example in the next section, where the method is passed two values. ## Examples 下面的示例尝试执行具有两个长整数乘法。The following example tries to perform multiplication with two long integers. 因为结果超出长整数的范围引发，和调用方法来处理该乘法运算。Because the result exceeds the range of a long integer, an is thrown, and the method is called to handle the multiplication. 请注意，C# 需要您使用两个`checked`关键字 （如本例所示） 或`/checked+`编译器选项，以确保在数值溢出将引发异常。Note that C# requires that you use either the `checked` keyword (as in this example) or the `/checked+` compiler option to make sure an exception is thrown on a numeric overflow. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定义的按位`And`操作值。The method defines the bitwise `And` operation for values. 按位`And`操作设置结果位仅当相应的位`left`和`right`还设置下, 表中所示。The bitwise `And` operation sets a result bit only if the corresponding bits in `left` and `right` are also set, as shown in the following table. |中的位 `left`Bit in `left`|中的位 `right`Bit in `right`|在结果中位Bit in result| |-------------------|--------------------|-------------------| |00|00|00| |11|00|00| |11|11|11| |00|11|00| 方法使代码如下所示：The method enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/Operator1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#1)] 方法执行按位`And`对两个操作值就好像在带虚拟符号扩展的补数表示形式。The method performs the bitwise `And` operation on two values as if they were both in two's complement representation with virtual sign extension.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载方法定义的类型，向其或从其可转换对象。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 语言编译器不会自动执行此转换，因为它会导致数据丢失。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss. 相反，他们才 （在 C#) 强制转换运算符或转换函数执行转换 (如`CType`或`CDbl`在 Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CDbl` in Visual Basic) is used. 因为值可以是外部的范围数据类型，此操作是收缩转换。Because the value can be outside the range of the data type, this operation is a narrowing conversion. 如果转换失败，它不会引发。If the conversion is unsuccessful, it does not throw an . 相反，如果值是小于，从而值是。Instead, if the value is less than , the resulting value is . 如果值大于，从而值是。If the value is greater than , the resulting value is . 转换到可能会丢失精度。The conversion of a to a may involve a loss of precision. 精度降低可能会成功执行该强制转换或转换操作导致在某些情况下，即使值的范围超出了数据类型。In some cases, the loss of precision may cause the casting or conversion operation to succeed even if the value is outside the range of the data type. 下面的示例进行了这方面的演示。The following example provides an illustration. 它分配的最大值为两个变量，将一个9.999 e 291, 并测试是否相等的两个变量的变量。It assigns the maximum value of a to two variables, increments one variable by 9.999e291, and tests the two variables for equality. 按预期方式调用方法演示它们是否不相等。As expected, the call to the method shows that they are unequal. 但是，将较大的转换值改回成功，尽管值现在超过。However, the conversion of the larger value back to a succeeds, although the value now exceeds . remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载方法定义的类型，向其或从其可转换对象。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 语言编译器不会自动执行此转换，因为它会导致数据丢失。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss. 相反，他们才 （在 C#) 强制转换运算符或转换函数执行转换 (如`CType`或`CULng`在 Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CULng` in Visual Basic) is used. 否则，它们显示编译器错误。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 此操作定义的收缩转换，因为它可能会引发如果在运行时值的范围超出了数据类型。Because this operation defines a narrowing conversion, it can throw an at run time if the value is outside the range of the data type. 没有在随后出现的精度不会丢失值转换是否成功。There is no loss of precision in the resulting value if the conversion is successful. ## Examples 下面的示例演示的转换到值。The following example illustrates the conversion of to values. 它还处理因为引发值的范围超出了数据类型。It also handles an that is thrown because the value is outside the range of the data type. remarks.format: ## Remarks 小数部分`value`在转换前截断参数。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 重载方法定义的类型，向其或从其可转换对象。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 因为从转换到截断小数部分可能涉及到`value`，语言编译器不会自动执行此转换。Because the conversion from to can involve truncating any fractional part of `value`, language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically. 相反，他们才 （在 C#) 强制转换运算符或转换函数执行转换 (如`CType`在 Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` in Visual Basic) is used. 否则，它们显示编译器错误。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 对于不支持自定义的运算符的语言的替代方法是。For languages that do not support custom operators, the alternative method is . ## Examples 以下示例将转换的数组中的各个元素值到对象，并显示每个转换的结果。The following example converts the individual elements in an array of values to objects, and then displays the result of each conversion. 请注意任何小数部分的一部分在转换期间截断的值。Note that any fractional part of a value is truncated during the conversion. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定义的取模运算符的运算值。The method defines the operation of the modulus operator for values. 它使代码如下所示：It enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#31](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#31)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#31](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#31)] 不支持自定义的运算符的语言可以调用方法相反。Languages that do not support custom operators can call the method instead. 取模运算返回的值的符号取决于的符号`dividend`： 如果`dividend`为正，取模运算返回出正结果; 如果它为负，取模运算返回负数的结果。The sign of the value returned by the modulus operation depends on the sign of `dividend`: If `dividend` is positive, the modulus operation returns a positive result; if it is negative, the modulus operation returns a negative result. 使用取模运算的行为值等同于与其他整数类型取模运算。The behavior of the modulus operation with values is identical to the modulus operation with other integral types. 此运算符的等效方法是。The equivalent method for this operator is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`参数应为以下形式的数字的字符串表示形式。The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a number in the following form. [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 将忽略任何前导零。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`value`参数解释使用样式。The string specified by the `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，而且不能包含小数部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数对象，将初始化为当前系统区域性。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 若要使用特定区域性的格式设置信息分析一个字符串，请使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您使用往返的字符串表示形式的方法的输出的值方法，则应使用方法使用"R"格式说明符生成的字符串表示形式值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否则为的字符串表示形式50，最高有效位的原始值和数据可能会丢失，当您使用仅保留方法来还原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来实例化两个对象。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 它将乘以另一个数的每个对象，然后调用方法来确定两个值之间的关系。It multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two values. ## Remarks `style`参数定义中允许的样式元素 （如空格、 正或负号符号、 组分隔符符号或十进制点符号）`value`分析操作成功的参数。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, the positive or negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `styles` 必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。`styles` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`参数将使得此方法重载非常有用`value`包含十六进制值的字符串表示形式时数系 （十进制或十六进制） 由`value`仅在运行时，已知时，或者当你想要禁止的空白区域或正负符号`value`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `value` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `value` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `value`. 具体取决于值`style`，则`value`参数可能包含以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空白可以出现在开头`value`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`value`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the 当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在`value`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 符号可以显示在开头`value`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`value`如果`style`包括标志。The sign can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag. 可以在使用括号`value`指示负值`style`包括标志。Parentheses can be used in `value` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `styles` 必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。`styles` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`参数将使得此方法重载非常有用`value`包含十六进制值的字符串表示形式时数系 （十进制或十六进制） 由`value`仅在运行时，已知时，或者当你想要禁止的空白区域或正负符号`value`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `value` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `value` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `value`. 具体取决于值`style`，则`value`参数可能包含以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: summary.span: 将 值转换为字节数组。

span.span: Converts a value to a byte array.

returns.span: 转换为字节数组的当前 对象的值。

span.span: The value of the current object converted to an array of bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的数组中的各个字节出现在 little-endian 顺序。The individual bytes in the array returned by this method appear in little-endian order. 也就是说，值的较低序位字节前加上更高序位字节。That is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes. 数组的第一个字节反映了第一个八位值，第二个字节反映的下一步的八位，依此类推。The first byte of the array reflects the first eight bits of the value, the second byte reflects the next eight bits, and so on. 例如，值 1024 或 0x0400，存储为以下两个字节的数组：For example, the value 1024, or 0x0400, is stored as the following array of two bytes: |元素Element|字节值Byte value| |-------------|----------------| |00|0x000x00| |11|0x040x04| 负值将写入数组中的最紧凑的窗体可能使用 2 的补数表示。Negative values are written to the array using two's complement representation in the most compact form possible. 例如，-1 表示为一个字节，其值是`0xFF`而不是数组其中多个元素，如`0xFF`，`0xFF`或`0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`。For example, -1 is represented as a single byte whose value is `0xFF` instead of as an array with multiple elements, such as `0xFF`, `0xFF` or `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`. 因为 2 的补数始终表示形式解释的最后一个字节数组中的最高顺序位 (位置处的字节 `- 1`) 用作符号位，该方法返回具有额外的元素值为零的字节数组到消除歧义正值，否则无法解释为具有设置其符号位。Because two's complement representation always interprets the highest-order bit of the last byte in the array (the byte at position `- 1`) as the sign bit, the method returns a byte array with an extra element whose value is zero to disambiguate positive values that could otherwise be interpreted as having their sign bits set. 例如，值 120 或`0x78`表示为单字节数组： `0x78`。For example, the value 120 or `0x78` is represented as a single-byte array: `0x78`. 但是，128 或`0x80`，表示为两个字节的数组： `0x80`， `0x00`。However, 128, or `0x80`, is represented as a two-byte array: `0x80`, `0x00`. 你可以往返值，从而将其存储为字节数组，然后将其使用还原构造函数。You can round-trip a value by storing it to a byte array and then restoring it using the constructor. > [!CAUTION] > 如果你的代码修改之前还原的值，此方法返回数组中的各个字节的值，则必须确保不要无意中更改符号位。If your code modifies the value of individual bytes in the array returned by this method before it restores the value, you must make sure that you do not unintentionally change the sign bit. 例如，如果您的修改增加一个正值，以便最高顺序位中的字节数组的最后一个元素将成为设置，可以添加其值为 0 到数组末尾的新字节。For example, if your modifications increase a positive value so that the highest-order bit in the last element of the byte array becomes set, you can add a new byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何一些值以字节数组表示。The following example illustrates how some values are represented in byte arrays. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/cs/ToByteArray1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/vb/ToByteArray1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式"R"或往返，当前区域性的格式中的值。The method formats a value in the "R", or round-trip, format of the current culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，按如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 字符串表示形式值包含负号，如果其值为负数，且从 0 到 9 之间，不带前导零的数字的序列。The string representation of the value includes a negative sign if its value is negative, and a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 without leading zeros. 负号由为当前区域性的对象。The negative sign is defined by the object for the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例显示使用默认值方法。The following example displays a value by using the default method. 它还显示的字符串表示形式使用一些标准格式说明符而得出的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using some standard format specifiers. 这些示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定来显示。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值中的"R"或往返，格式化通过使用指定区域性的对象。The method formats a value in the "R", or round-trip, format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式或当前区域性，使用的其他重载方法，按如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `provider`参数是实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法将返回提供此方法返回的字符串的格式的区域性特定信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 如果`provider`是`null`，则值进行格式设置使用当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the value is formatted using the object of the current culture. 唯一的属性对象，用于控制的字符串表示形式值使用常规格式说明符是，它定义表示负号的字符。The only property of the object that controls the string representation of the value using the general format specifier is , which defines the character that represents the negative sign. `provider`参数可以是以下值之一：The `provider` parameter can be one of the following: - 一个对象，表示提供格式设置信息的区域性。A object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. - 提供格式设置信息的对象。The object that supplies formatting information. - 实现一个自定义对象。A custom object that implements . 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that supplies formatting information. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化一个自定义波形符 （~） 定义为一个负号的对象。The following example instantiates a custom object that defines the tilde (~) as a negative sign. 方法，然后使用自定义对象来显示一个负值。The method then uses the custom object to display a negative value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式通过使用指定的格式值对象，表示当前区域性的约定。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要使用"R"或往返，设置格式或指定不同的区域性，使用的其他重载方法，按如下所示：If you want to use the "R", or round-trip, format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或的任意组合[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [custom numeric format strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等同于是否`null`，当前的返回值对象往返格式说明符 ("R") 进行格式设置。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the round-trip format specifier ("R"). 如果`format`为其他任何值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，其格式设置的以下主题中更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关对.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回字符串的格式由为当前区域性的对象。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 具体取决于`format`参数，此对象可以控制在输出字符串中的负号、 组分隔符和小数点符号等符号。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供除当前区域性以外区域性的格式设置信息，请调用重载。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例初始化值并将其显示通过使用每个标准格式字符串和一些自定义格式字符串。The following example initializes a value and displays it by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式通过使用指定的格式值指定区域性的对象。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果你想要使用往返格式或默认区域性设置，使用的其他重载方法，按如下所示：If you want to use the round-trip format or default culture settings, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或的任意组合[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [custom numeric format strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等同于是否`null`，当前的返回值对象往返格式说明符 ("R") 进行格式设置。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the round-trip format specifier ("R"). 如果`format`为其他任何值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，其格式设置的以下主题中更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关对.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `provider`参数是实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法将返回提供此方法返回的字符串的格式的区域性特定信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 当调用方法时，它调用`provider`参数的方法并将其传递对象，表示类型。When the method is invoked, it calls the `provider` parameter's method and passes it a object that represents the type. 方法随后返回提供的格式设置信息的对象`value`参数，如负号符号、 组分隔符符号或小数点符号。The method then returns the object that provides information for formatting the `value` parameter, such as the negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol. 有三种方法使用`provider`参数来提供到格式设置信息方法：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply formatting information to the method: - 可以将传递对象，表示提供格式设置信息的区域性。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法将返回提供该区域性的数字格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以将传递的实际提供数字格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (其实现只返回其自身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 可以传递用于实现的自定义对象。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法实例化并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，则返回的字符串的格式设置基于当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例初始化值，并将其显示在控制台中使用标准格式字符串和一个波形符 （~） 定义为一个负号的对象。The following example initializes a value, and displays it to the console using a standard format string and a object that defines the tilde (~) as a negative sign. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 此方法无需使用异常处理来测试如果`value`无效，不能成功分析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `value`参数应为以下形式的十进制数字的字符串表示形式：The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的十进制数字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`value`参数不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，而且不能包含小数部分。The string specified by the `value` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`参数解释使用样式。The `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 除了十进制数字，允许仅前导空格和尾随空格以及前导符号。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义使用可出现在特定于区域性的格式设置信息的样式元素`value`，调用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `value`, call the method. `value`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数为当前区域性的对象。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 此重载将解释中的所有位`value`为十进制数字的参数。This overload interprets all digits in the `value` parameter as decimal digits. 若要分析的十六进制数字的字符串表示形式，请调用改为重载。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来实例化两个对象。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 如果转换成功，它将乘以另一个数的每个对象，然后调用方法来确定两个对象之间的关系。If the conversions succeed, it multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two objects.
